document.docTitle: Systaria lanna Dankittipakul & Singtripop, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Seven new species of Systaria Simon, 1897 from Southeast Asia (Araneae, Clubionidae, Systariinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Seven new species of Systaria Simon, 1897 from Southeast Asia (Araneae, Clubionidae, Systariinae)

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 15 – 19. Systaria lanna sp. nov., holotype male (15 – 17) and paratype female (18 – 19). 15 – 17 Left male palp (15 ventral, 16 retrolateral, 17 dorsal); 18 Epigyne, ventral; 19 Vulva, dorsal. Scale lines = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype :
3 ,
THAILAND : Mae Hong Son Province :
Tham Lod [= incorrect transliteration by collectors as Tham Lok], 5 km north of Mae Lang,
14 November 1985
, leg. B. & I. Löbl ( MHNG , Sys-01).

Paratypes :
13 , same data as holotype ( THNM , Sys-01).
THAILAND : Mae Hong Son Province :
1 Ƥ, Pang Ma Pha District, Tham Lod, 450 m , cave entrance,
31 December 2006
, leg. P. Dankittipakul ( MHNG , Sys-02).
Chiang Mai Province :
2 Ƥ, Chiang Dao District, Tham Krab, 400 m , cave entrance,
23 December 2004
, leg. P. Dankittipakul ( MHNG , Sys-03; THNM ).

Diagnosis. Males of
S. lanna
sp. nov.
are recognized by the hook-like process on the complex RTA (
Figs 15– 17
); females by the elongate-ovoid anterior bursae, and the elongate-ovoid posterior spermathecae (
Fig. 19
).
Etymology. The specific epithet is a noun in apposition, referring to the old independent state of Lanna (modern northern Thailand ) where the types of this new species were collected.

Description. Male ( holotype ): Total length 11.0. Prosoma 5.02 long, 3.56 wide. Opisthosoma 5.98 long, 3.30 wide. Leg formula: 4123 ; I 10.24 ( 2.92 , 1.56 , 2.84 , 1.88 , 1.04 ); II 9.66 ( 2.86 , 1.42 , 2.58 , 1.82 , 0.98 ); III 9.16 ( 3.14 , 0.98 , 1.96 , 2.16 , 0.92 ); IV 13.58 ( 3.82 , 1.48 , 2.98 , 3.52 , 1.78 ). Spination. Femora: I d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 0-1 , r 1 - 0-1 ; II d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 -0, r 0-1 - 2 ; III d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 0-1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r0- 0-1 . Tibiae: I
v 2
- 0-2 ; II
v 2 - 2
-0; III p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 - 0- 1 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; IV p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 - 0-1 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 . Metatarsi: II
v 1
-0-0; III p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 1 - 1
-2; IV p 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 . Eye size and interdistances: AME 0.16 , ALE 0.12 , PME 0.12 , PLE 0.10 ; AME–AME 0.18 , AME–ALE 0.16 , PME– PME 0.24 , PME–PLE 0.18 , ALE–PLE 0.14 ; MOA 0.26 long, anterior width 0.38 , posterior width 0.36 .

Natural history. Types of
S. lanna
sp. nov.
were directly taken from their retreats on the wall at the cave entrance.
